## ğŸ“Œ Project Overview

This project focuses on identifying, analyzing, and reducing **stockouts** (out-of-stock events) in a simulated retail dataset. By applying the **DMAIC (Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve, Control)** method, we explore how promotions, seasonality, and product categories affect inventory performance.

The project uses **R programming** (compatible with older versions) to process and visualize over 76,000 observations from 5 product categories across multiple stores.

```

```

##  Summary of Results

- Highest stockouts observed in **Groceries**, especially during **Winter and promotional periods**
- Promotions increase sales but also raise risk of stockouts
- Stores have varying performance in stockout rates due to possible planning issues
